sections.name: Chart of Accounts & General Ledger Structure

items.requirement: Hierarchical CoA with account groups (Assets, Liabilities, Equity, Revenue, Expense)
Account type enforcement (debit-normal vs credit-normal)
Multi-ledger: IFRS ledger, local GAAP ledger, tax ledger per legal entity
Posting period control: open / soft-close / hard-close per (company, ledger, period)
Document types + posting keys per company (invoice, payment, journal, reversal)
Number ranges per document type per company (fiscal-year-dependent)
Account balance = sum of all posted journal lines (no separate balance table)
Trial balance at any point-in-time (`asOf`) — not just period-end
Segment / cost-center / profit-center dimensions on journal lines
Intercompany elimination accounts (IC payable / IC receivable mirror pairs)
Every posting: sum(debits) = sum(credits) enforced at DB level
Journal entry header + lines (1:N) — header carries doc metadata, lines carry amounts
Functional currency + transaction currency on every line (IAS 21)
Reversal journal: auto-creates mirror entry on period open
Posting status machine: draft → posted → reversed (no direct delete)
Document splitting by segment/cost center (proportional allocation)
Recurring journal templates (fixed amount or formula-based)
Batch posting with rollback on any line failure
Audit trail: who posted, when, from which source document
Integer minor units for all monetary amounts (no floating point)
3-way match: Purchase Order → Goods Receipt → Supplier Invoice
Supplier invoice aging (0–30, 31–60, 61–90, 90+ days)
Payment run: batch selection by due date, bank, currency
Early payment discount capture (2/10 net 30 terms)
Supplier statement reconciliation
ISO 20022 `pain.001` payment file generation
Withholding tax deduction at payment (WHT)
Debit memo / credit note handling
Duplicate invoice detection (supplier + invoice number + amount)
Accrued liabilities for uninvoiced GRs at period-end
Customer invoice with line-level tax, discount, and net amount
Payment allocation: FIFO, specific invoice, or oldest-first
Customer aging report (0–30, 31–60, 61–90, 90+ days)
ECL provisioning: IFRS 9 Stage 1/2/3 (PD × LGD × EAD)
Write-off workflow with approval gate
Collection action tracking (calls, letters, legal)
Credit note / return handling
Intercompany receivable matching
Factoring / assignment of receivables
Revenue recognition integration (IFRS 15 5-step model)
5-step model: identify contract → POB → transaction price → allocate → recognize
Performance obligation (POB) identification per contract
Standalone selling price (SSP) allocation across POBs
Point-in-time vs over-time recognition criteria
Percentage-of-completion (cost-to-cost method) for over-time
Variable consideration constraint assessment
Contract modification: prospective vs cumulative catch-up
Contract asset vs contract liability (deferred revenue)
Milestone-based recognition (output method)
Subscription / SaaS: ratable recognition over service period
Asset register: cost, accumulated depreciation, net book value
Depreciation methods: straight-line, declining balance, units-of-production
Useful life + residual value review annually
Component accounting: major components depreciated separately
Revaluation model: fair value uplift → OCI reserve
Impairment testing: recoverable amount vs carrying amount
Disposal: gain/loss = proceeds − NBV
Bulk depreciation run: all assets in one batch intent
Asset transfer between companies / cost centers
Capital work-in-progress (CWIP) → asset capitalization
Right-of-use (ROU) asset recognition at commencement
Lease liability: PV of future lease payments at incremental borrowing rate
Amortization schedule: interest + principal split per period
Lease modification: remeasurement of liability + ROU
Lease termination: derecognition of ROU + liability
Short-term lease exemption (≤12 months)
Low-value asset exemption
Variable lease payments (index-linked)
Sale-and-leaseback accounting
Lessor accounting: finance vs operating lease classification
Multi-jurisdiction tax rate tables (time-bounded, effective_from/to)
Tax code hierarchy: country → state/province → city
Input tax vs output tax netting for VAT/GST return
Tax return aggregation by period and company
SAF-T (Standard Audit File for Tax) export
Withholding tax (WHT): rate per payee type + treaty override
Deferred tax: temporary difference method (IAS 12)
Tax provision calculation (current + deferred)
Country-specific formats: MY SST, SG GST, UK VAT, EU VAT, US sales tax
Transfer pricing: arm's-length price validation
Group ownership hierarchy (parent → subsidiary → sub-subsidiary)
Intercompany transaction matching (IC payable = IC receivable)
IC elimination: revenue vs cost, receivable vs payable
Non-controlling interest (NCI) calculation
Goodwill on acquisition (IFRS 3): purchase price allocation
Currency translation: functional → presentation currency (IAS 21)
Ownership % change over time (acquisition / disposal)
Dividend elimination (IC dividend = equity reduction)
IC netting: offset payables vs receivables for settlement
Consolidation journal: auto-generated from IC matching results
Bank account master: IBAN, SWIFT, currency, company
Cash flow forecast: actual + committed + projected
Actual vs forecast variance analysis
Cash pooling / notional pooling positions
Bank statement import: OFX, MT940, camt.053, CSV
Covenant monitoring: debt covenants with breach alerts
FX exposure reporting: net open position by currency
Investment portfolio tracking (money market, bonds)
Intercompany loan management
Cash flow statement (indirect method) auto-generation
FX rate types: spot, average, closing, budget, hedge
Period-end revaluation of monetary items
OCI translation difference tracking (functional → presentation)
Forward contract fair value calculation
Hedge effectiveness testing: 80%–125% range
FX gain/loss: realized vs unrealized separation
Multi-currency bank reconciliation
Rate source audit trail (ECB, Bloomberg, manual)
Triangulation: cross-rate via USD (A/USD × USD/B)
Functional currency determination per entity
Period-end close checklist with task ownership and evidence
Accrual run: auto-generate accrual journals from templates
Allocation run: overhead → cost centers (step-down method)
Reclassification journals (reclass)
Multi-company close: entity-level → group-level sequencing
Balance sheet (IAS 1 §54 line items)
Income statement: by nature or by function
Cash flow statement: indirect method (IAS 7)
Statement of changes in equity
Notes to financial statements (disclosure pack)
Budget versions: original / revised / latest estimate
Bottom-up budget entry by cost center / department
Budget consolidation across companies
Rolling forecast vs static annual budget
Budget vs actual variance report
Budget commitment: encumber on PO creation
Budget period: monthly / quarterly / annual
Workflow approval for budget submissions
Scenario planning (base / upside / downside)
Budget import from spreadsheet (CSV/Excel)
Cost center hierarchy (company → division → department)
Cost allocation: direct, step-down, reciprocal methods
Activity-based costing (ABC): activity drivers + rates
Standard costing: variance analysis (price, quantity, efficiency)
Job costing vs process costing distinction
Overhead absorption rate + under/over-absorption
BOM explosion: multi-level with waste %
WIP valuation and transfer to finished goods
Cost rollup: raw material → WIP → finished goods
Profitability analysis by product / customer / region
Project master: budget, start/end date, billing type
Cost posting to project (labor, material, expense)
Earned value management: EV, PV, AC, CPI, SPI
Percentage-of-completion revenue recognition
WIP-to-revenue transfer journal
Project billing: milestone, time-and-material, fixed-fee
Intercompany project cost recharge
Project profitability report
Resource utilization tracking
Grant accounting: conditions + deferred income
Credit limit per customer (amount + currency)
Credit exposure: outstanding invoices + open orders
Credit hold / release workflow with approval
Credit review scheduling (annual / triggered)
Credit scoring model (configurable weights)
Dunning: escalating letters (1st, 2nd, 3rd notice)
Bad debt write-off workflow
Insurance / guarantee tracking
Customer payment history analysis
ECL integration: credit score → IFRS 9 staging
Bank statement import: OFX, MT940, camt.053, CSV
Auto-matching: amount + date + reference
Manual match for complex transactions
Auto-post confirmed matches to GL
Unmatched item investigation workflow
Outstanding checks / deposits-in-transit tracking
Bank charges auto-recognition
Multi-currency reconciliation
Reconciliation sign-off with evidence
Intraday balance monitoring (real-time feed)
Expense claim submission with receipt attachment
Multi-level approval routing (amount-based)
Per-diem rate tables (jurisdiction-aware, time-bounded)
Mileage rate calculation (per km/mile)
Policy enforcement: category limits, blacklisted vendors
Corporate card reconciliation hook
Foreign currency expense reimbursement (IAS 21)
Project / cost center coding on expense lines
Reimbursement payment via AP run
Tax reclaim on business expenses (VAT/GST)
Subscription plan master: price, billing cycle, trial
Ratable revenue recognition over service period
Invoice generation on billing cycle trigger
Dunning for failed renewals (retry + escalation)
Upgrade / downgrade mid-cycle proration
Usage-based billing metering (API calls, seats, GB)
Contract modification: IFRS 15 §20 treatment
Churn tracking and MRR/ARR reporting
Tax calculation on recurring invoices
Payment gateway integration hook (Stripe, Braintree)
Recognition criteria: probable + reliable estimate
Best estimate: single amount or expected value
Discount unwind: time value of money for long-term provisions
Provision utilisation: actual spend vs provision
Provision reversal: no longer probable
Contingent liability disclosure (not recognized)
Onerous contract provision
Restructuring provision: formal plan + announcement
Environmental / decommissioning provision
Discount rate selection (risk-free, pre-tax)
Recognition criteria: identifiable, controlled, future economic benefits
Research phase → expense always
Development phase → capitalize if 6 criteria met
Amortization: useful life determination (finite vs indefinite)
Impairment test for indefinite-life intangibles (annual)
Internally generated goodwill: prohibited
Computer software: capitalize development, expense research
Customer lists / relationships acquired in business combination
Revaluation model (active market required)
Disclosure: gross carrying amount, accumulated amortization
Classification: AC / FVOCI / FVTPL based on business model + SPPI test
Effective interest rate (EIR) method for amortised cost
Fair value measurement: Level 1 / 2 / 3 hierarchy
Fair value change: OCI vs P&L routing by classification
ECL model: 12-month vs lifetime ECL (Stage 1/2/3)
Derecognition: transfer of risks and rewards test
Derivatives: fair value through P&L (default)
Compound instruments: split liability + equity components
IFRS 7 disclosures: credit risk, liquidity risk, market risk
Offsetting: legal right + intention to net settle
Hedge designation: hedging instrument + hedged item + hedge type
Hedge types: fair value, cash flow, net investment
Effectiveness testing: economic relationship + credit risk not dominant
OCI reserve: effective portion of cash flow hedge
Ineffectiveness: recognized immediately in P&L
Discontinuation: on failure or voluntary de-designation
Net investment hedge: OCI until disposal of foreign operation
Rebalancing: adjust hedge ratio without discontinuation
Basis adjustment: reclassify OCI to asset/liability cost
Disclosure: risk management strategy, hedge effectiveness
Arm's-length principle: IC price = comparable uncontrolled price
Transfer pricing methods: CUP, resale price, cost-plus, TNMM, profit split
IC agreement master: from/to company, item type, method, markup %
Price validation at transaction time: flag out-of-range
TP documentation: master file + local file
Advance pricing agreement (APA) tracking
TP adjustment: year-end true-up journal
Country-by-country reporting (CbCR)
Thin capitalization: interest deductibility limits
Permanent establishment risk flag
Segregation of duties: preparer ≠ approver ≠ poster

evidence.implementation: packages\workflow\src\conditions.ts → role; packages\workflow\src\index.ts → role; packages\workflow\src\interpreter.ts → role

items.requirement: Authorization matrix: amount thresholds per role

evidence.implementation: packages\workflow\src\conditions.ts → role; packages\workflow\src\index.ts → role; packages\workflow\src\interpreter.ts → role

items.requirement: Audit trail: immutable log of all mutations (who, what, when, before/after)

evidence.implementation: packages\crud\src\commit\allocate-doc-number.ts → before, after; packages\crud\src\commit\apply-entity.ts → what, before, after; packages\crud\src\commit\commit-plan.ts → audit_log, Audit, before

items.requirement: Period-end lock: no posting to closed period without override

evidence.implementation: packages\database\src\schema\fiscal-periods.ts → posting, closed, period; packages\crud\src\commit\allocate-doc-number.ts → lock; packages\crud\src\commit\apply-entity.ts → lock, override

items.requirement: Reconciliation controls: sub-ledger = GL balance
Duplicate payment prevention: idempotency key on payment intents

evidence.implementation: packages\crud\src\commit\commit-plan.ts → intents; packages\crud\src\commit\write-audit.ts → idempotency, idempotencyKey; packages\crud\src\commit\write-idempotency.ts → idempotency, idempotencyKey, Duplicate

items.requirement: Four-eyes principle on high-value transactions

evidence.implementation: packages\workflow\src\v2\approval-resolver.ts → approval, approve; packages\workflow\src\v2\dsl-evaluator.ts → approval; packages\workflow\src\v2\edit-window.ts → approve

items.requirement: Exception reporting: transactions outside policy thresholds

evidence.implementation: packages\advisory\src\detectors\cusum.ts → threshold; packages\advisory\src\detectors\ewma.ts → threshold; packages\advisory\src\detectors\mad.ts → threshold

items.requirement: User access review: quarterly role certification

evidence.implementation: packages\workflow\src\conditions.ts → role; packages\workflow\src\index.ts → role; packages\workflow\src\interpreter.ts → role

items.requirement: Change management: versioned rules, no silent overrides

evidence.implementation: packages\workflow\src\conditions.ts → Change, rules; packages\workflow\src\db-loader.ts → rules; packages\workflow\src\engine.ts → rules

items.requirement: Integer minor units for all monetary storage (no FLOAT/DECIMAL for money)
Tenant isolation: org_id on every table + RLS enforced

evidence.implementation: packages\database\src\schema\acct-derived-entries.ts → orgId, org_id, Tenant; packages\database\src\schema\acct-events.ts → orgId, org_id, Tenant; packages\database\src\schema\acct-mapping-versions.ts → orgId, org_id, Tenant

items.requirement: Optimistic concurrency: expectedVersion on all mutations
Soft delete: deleted_at timestamp, never hard DELETE on financial records

evidence.implementation: packages\database\src\helpers\base-entity.ts → deletedAt, deleted_at, Soft; packages\database\src\helpers\db-retry.ts → never; packages\database\src\helpers\doc-entity.ts → timestamp

items.requirement: Effective dating: effective_from / effective_to on rate/rule tables
Idempotency keys on all write operations

evidence.implementation: packages\crud\src\commit\apply-entity.ts → write; packages\crud\src\commit\commit-plan.ts → write; packages\crud\src\commit\session.ts → write

items.requirement: Append-only audit log: REVOKE UPDATE/DELETE from authenticated

evidence.implementation: packages\database\src\schema\audit-logs.ts → audit_log, auditLog, Append-only; packages\crud\src\commit\allocate-doc-number.ts → UPDATE; packages\crud\src\commit\apply-entity.ts → UPDATE, DELETE

items.requirement: Deterministic hash on derived entries (inputs + rule version → hash)

evidence.implementation: packages\crud\src\commit\apply-entity.ts → version; packages\crud\src\commit\commit-plan.ts → version; packages\crud\src\commit\compute-diff.ts → entries

items.requirement: Partitioned tables for high-volume data (audit_logs, journal lines)

evidence.implementation: business-domain\finance\accounting\src\calculators\batch-posting.ts → journal; business-domain\finance\accounting\src\calculators\journal-balance.ts → journal, lines; business-domain\finance\accounting\src\calculators\partition-readiness.ts → partition, PARTITION, assessPartitionReadiness

items.requirement: Read replica routing for reporting queries

evidence.implementation: packages\database\src\auth-context.ts → Read; packages\database\src\db-session.ts → dbRo, Read, replica; packages\database\src\db.ts → dbRo, Read, reporting

items.requirement: Balance sheet per IAS 1 §54 minimum line items
Income statement: by nature (MY/SG) or by function (US/UK)
Statement of changes in equity
Cash flow statement: indirect method (IAS 7)
Notes: accounting policies, estimates, judgements
Segment reporting: operating segments per IFRS 8
Related party disclosures (IAS 24)
Events after reporting period (IAS 10)
Earnings per share (IAS 33)
XBRL tagging for regulatory filing

sections.name: Subledger Accounting Architecture (SAP SLA / Oracle SLA Pattern)

items.requirement: Operational domains emit AccountingEvent — not hand-crafted journals
Mapping rules: event class → journal template (versioned)

evidence.implementation: packages\database\src\schema\acct-mappings.ts → Mapping, rules, event; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\accrual-calculator.ts → journal, template; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\derivation-engine.ts → mappingRule, deriveJournalLines, Mapping

items.requirement: Deterministic replay: same event + rule version → identical journal

evidence.implementation: business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\accrual-calculator.ts → journal; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\derivation-engine.ts → computeDerivationId, Deterministic, event; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\preview-mode.ts → event, journal

items.requirement: Multi-ledger derivation: one event → IFRS + local GAAP + tax journals

evidence.implementation: business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\accrual-calculator.ts → journals; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\derivation-engine.ts → deriveJournalLines, derivation, event; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\preview-mode.ts → derivation, event

items.requirement: Posting audit: inputs_snapshot_hash + rule_version + reason_codes on every derived entry

evidence.implementation: packages\database\src\schema\acct-derived-entries.ts → derivationId, Posting, derived; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\derivation-engine.ts → derivationId, derived; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\preview-mode.ts → Posting

items.requirement: Preview mode: derive without posting (what-if)
Event store: immutable acct_events table (append-only)
Mapping version lifecycle: draft → published → deprecated
No direct GL write from operational packages (FIN-05 gate)
Reconciliation: acct_events count = acct_derived_entries count per period

evidence.implementation: business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\accrual-calculator.ts → count, period; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\derivation-engine.ts → derivation, count; business-domain\finance\accounting-hub\src\calculators\preview-mode.ts → derivation, count
